ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments:
- Better understanding of grammar both in English and Portuguese.
- knowledge into Brazilian Culture
-Increased Political Awareness

The biggest skill I learned in this class is learning in an active classroom environment. Almost the entire class was discussed in Portuguese and I learned how to learn through context which was very effective.
A general knowledge of Portuguese and culture from Brazil
Learned elementary Portuguese from zero knowledge to basic past and present verb conjugations, basic daily vocabulary, and themes about city life.
Basic Portuguese grammar and knowledge about Brazilian culture.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: 
- weekly plans 
-very interactive 
-lots of group work 
-topics are engaging

The strengths of the class are that it is extremely interesting as we explore the language through many different types of media as well as promotes a friendly classroom environment where it is easy to interact with anyone in the class. It could be improved only by making the structure of the class in terms of the main topics being dealt with a little more clear.

Strengths: format of course works well
Weaknesses: more handouts and paper reference sheets  digital resources are good but writing things down/having physical copies of things to look back to greatly helps students' learning
My strengths were that I had a lot of fun in the class, which allowed me to learn more efficiently. My weaknesses in the class were that I didnt really know anybody.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes- I have come on significantly in my ability to speak ,read and write the language and also feel I have gained a better understanding of the world around me.

Absolutely. I would strongly recommend this course. This course engaged learning by exploring the diverse cultures that use the language and personally relevant use of the language, like describing what you do, what you study, and who you are.

Yes, I would, especially for people who want a good introduction to romance languages. The class is very open for beginners as I had never taken Spanish before and I felt like I was able to pick up on the material fairly quickly.
Absolutely best course and best instructor
Absolutely. First step to learning Portuguese, and it's a good first step  especially if you put in work to be dedicated to it.
Yes, Portuguese is one of the few language classes that doesnt have a super traditional learning method. In other words, you learn the language while learning the culture, not vice versa.
